column4: Hiya - can someone please tell me why my system with a netgear ma401 card shows up two interfaces, wlan0 and wifi0, both with the same MAC and crypto settings?
wifi0 is an internally used interface, just ignore it
it's stuffing things up, I can't ignore it. ARP entries get tied to it and I then can't communicate with those hosts

i.e. I just rebooted it and though it associated with the AP, I couldn't ping it... go on the console and it's got a correct ARP against wlan0 and an incomplete against wifi0. Down and up wifi0 and all's good, but you need local access to do that
thats strange wifi0 usually doesnt interfere
it's a real pain in the behind!
best I can think of to do is maybe a post-up... but it's not that predictable, some boots it just works :o\
im not sure that wifi0 is really your problem there
what else could it be? if I down and up wifi0 all my problems go away
right, right it might be it after all, check this out https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/WiFiHowTo
search the page for wifi0
I tried blacklisting hostap stuff earlier and it didn't create wifi0... but not wlan0 either. I followed a different method, though, so will try this now....
just rebooting that box now... soon see if it kills or cures :)
hehe
no dice... though I still have both interfaces so I guess it didn't do anything (apart from add a weird little triangle after my ESSID)
erm, hold fire, may have pasted that in the wrong box
while I'm in here, anyone know how to make middle button in firefox open the url in the cut buffer rather than bring up that windows-style scroller widget?
still the same... I've exhausted my imagination as far as search keywords go... should I just bin the NIC or what?
though this machine uses a linksys, which is not free of problems. The GUI configuration tool didn't work on either box
i dunno what to tell u, i tried removing wifi0 myself but after ubuntu info reassured me its normal i kinda stopped trying
cheers for the help. I guess it's just one of those annoying things! Hopefully will be phasing that machine out once I get qmail running on this one anyway
